fields.description:
Jira and Confluence backups take forever to generate and then downloading is another challenge. 

For example - 300GB jira site can take approximately 18 hours to generate a 100GB zip. 
There is no indication on how long this would take for the user and customers have to rely on constantly checking the UI to know when it is ready.
fields.summary: Generating a site backup should be faster

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When migrating a space from Confluence Cloud to another instance, if there are any links in the pages pointing to the old instance, they will be unchanged after migration, causing the links to stop working.
h3. Suggestion

Have a pre-check step before space gets migrated and enable the user to change the links to point to the new site.

h3. Notes
These are generally in pages created in much older versions of Confluence, as recent editors 

 
h3. Workaround

[Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Detect and change links in the body of pages after a Confluence Space migration

fields.description:
Confluence Cloud does not currently provide an in product mechanism that would allow an admin to reset the site back to an empty site, effectively removing all Confluence spaces and their pages. Resetting a site is a common task as part of migration activities since many admins complete multiple dry runs prior to moving to production. This feature request is aimed at providing an in-app mechanism that allows for the content to be cleared gracefully without negatively affecting the users, groups, apps and licensing on a Confluence Cloud instance.

*Our current workaround methods are*: 
 # Deleting all spaces/pages from the cloud instance manually by updating the database directly through Governator
 # Reset all Confluence data by by [Unsubscribing/Resubscribing the Product|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html#:~:text=On%20your%20cloud%20site%2C%20go,DELETE%20into%20the%20field.]

h4. Notes on the available workarounds
 * Deleting spaces manually is an inefficient use of time and can drastically impact support resources depending on how large a site clean up may be
 * Importing a blank Confluence backup is no longer an option if Confluence is connected to Jira which is sometimes the case for customers who migrate Jira before Confluence. 
 * [Unsubcribing/resubscribing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html] to the product can sometimes cause licensing issues (ECTL and other billing issues) and requires admins to engage with Migrations Support & CA Support to address. This can have the potential to affect/block production migrations.
 * Unsubscribing from the product also causes all downloaded apps to be reset - so in cases where there are many apps installed, admins have to manually re-install all of the plugins.
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism to wipe all Confluence data from a given site

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A customer was trying to import a Confluence with a file containing "[]" - brackets - in its name, but Zipper fails to extract the file due to the illegal characters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Export a confluence space to a zip file
 # Step 2 - rename the file to "[something] filename.zip"
 # Try to import the space on a confluence instance

h3. Expected Results

The import file is imported correctly regardless of its name.
h3. Actual Results

This exception will be thrown in the backend logs in the Cloud:
{noformat}
stack: com.atlassian.confluence.zipper.ConfluenceZipperException: Unable to call to Zipper, Failure{reason=BAD_STATUS, statusCode=400, message=ZIP file is corrupted. Unzipping failed}com.atlassian.confluence.zipper.DefaultConfluenceZipperClient.verifyResult(DefaultConfluenceZipperClient.java:122)com.atlassian.confluence.zipper.DefaultConfluenceZipperClient.unzip(DefaultConfluenceZipperClient.java:93)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Rename the file, removing all illegal characters (especially brackets - [ ]) from its name.
fields.summary: Confluence import error when file name contains brackets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a DrawIO to Page A, for example, the app allows a user to add a diagram that exists in PageB. This means that Page A will show a diagram that is actually stored inside PageB. It is called a [Linked Diagram|https://drawio-app.com/linking-content-in-draw-io-diagrams/].

The link happens based on PageID. As PageIDs will change when migrating from Server to Cloud, the relationship is then broken, giving users the impression that DrawIO Diagrams (attachments) were not migrated over.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install DrawIO.
# Create a page, say Page A.
# Add a DrawIO diagram to it, let's name it as Diagram A.
# Save the page. Create a new page, say Page B.
# Add a DrawIo diagram to it. When adding it, use the universal search to search for Diagram A and link to it.
# Page B will now have Diagram A on it, which is inside Page A.
# Save the page.
# Migrate to Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
Diagram A is still working on Page B.

h3. Actual Results
Page B will show a message that says *Diagram not Found* where it should have showed Diagram A. This is because the backend is still pointing to Page A Server's ID. Example:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="diagramName">Diagram A</ac:parameter><ac:parameter ac:name="pageId">12345678</ac:parameter>
{code}

h3. Workaround
Atlassian can update this information in the backend database if one knows which pages are broken and the title of the pages where the linked diagrams are sitting at.

One could also access the broken pages and edit the DrawIO macro to re-create the link and update PageID accordingly in the backend.
fields.summary: DrawIO linked diagrams will stop working after a migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This bug is semi related to CONFSERVER-57972

Confluence space imports can fail when it hits a constraint violation for rows in the *{{os_propertyentry}}* table for *{{create.blueprint.page.draft.request}}* . This table can contain superfluous rows for drafts created from blueprint which can cause problems with import.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

TBD
h3. Expected Results

The constraint violation doesn't cause the whole import to fail.
h3. Actual Results

The import fails and the following stack trace is visible:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "os_propertyentry_pkey"
  Detail: Key (entity_name, entity_id, entity_key)=(confluence_ContentEntityObject, 123456789 create.blueprint.page.draft.request) already exists.
{code}
h3. Workaround

We will need to remove the entity ID from the import file to workaround the constraint issue. In the sample stack trace above, the content entity id is *123456789*.
 # Unzip the import file
 # Run the following grep searching for the entity ID from the stacktrace to find the associated object:
{code:java}
grep '<entity-id-here>' entities.xml
{code}
 # Once you find the object, we'll need to remove it. In this example, this entire object needed to be removed from the entities.xml file. 
{code:java}
<object class="BucketPropertySetItem" package="bucket.user.propertyset">
<composite-id><property name="entityName" type="string"><![CDATA[confluence_ContentEntityObject]]></property>
<property name="entityId" type="long">123456789</property>
<property name="key" type="string"><![CDATA[create.blueprint.page.draft.request]]></property>
</composite-id>
<property name="type">6</property>
<property name="booleanVal">false</property>
<property name="doubleVal">0.0</property>
<property name="stringVal"/><property name="textVal"><![CDATA[{"spaceKey":"TEST","contentBlueprintId":"xxxx-xxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx","contentTemplateId":"","contentTemplateKey":"","title":"","viewPermissionsUsers":"","parentPageId":10000000,"moduleCompleteKey":null,"context":{"name":"Try the new editing experience","description":"Use new features like live macros, decisions, and smart link previews","styleClass":"fabriceditor-blueprint-icon large","iconURL":"/wiki/s/2062034633/6452/bd59249d891970d64c288e9edac2da6c80b2253b/1000.0.0-bd59249d891/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-create-content-plugin:resources/images/preview-default-template.png","itemModuleCompleteKey":"com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-business-blueprints:fabric-editor-item","blueprintModuleCompleteKey":"com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-business-blueprints:fabriceditor-blueprint","contentBlueprintId":"xxxx-xxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx","skipHowToUse":false,"isNew":true,"isPromoted":false,"promoted":false,"new":true,"spaceKey":"TEST"}}]]></property>
<property name="longVal">0</property>
<property name="intVal">0</property>
<property name="dateVal"/></object>
{code}
4. Rezip the file and retry the import:
{code}
zip -r import.zip entities.xml exportDescriptor.properties attachments/
{code}
fields.summary: Space Import fails due to a constraint violation on os_propertyentry_pkey

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have space permissions in Confluence Server attributed to the confluence-users group and in the Cloud, you have changed the confluence-users from a product/default access to a custom group and subsequently, you do a reset of your Cloud site using the unsubscribe method listed [in this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html] you will notice the permissions will get switched from the confluence-users group to the new group you have chosen. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Cloud site
# In the product access screen in the user management
# In the Confluence tab assign a new group as the product access and default access group, remove the confluence-users as a default/product access group
# Unsubscribe from Confluence
# Migrate the spaces from Server to Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The permissions associated with the confluence-users group will be retained on Cloud.

h3. Actual Results

The permissions that were previously associated with the confluence-users group will get associate with the new group you have placed as the product access.

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-08 at 17.54.50.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-08 at 16.54.38.png|thumbnail! 


*Note*

It is a silent problem no exceptions are found in the backend.

h3. Workaround

Wait until after you migrate to do changes to the product access groups
fields.summary: Space permissions for the confluence-users group gets switched to another product access group

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When doing a Confluence Cloud space export to import into another Confluence Cloud instance, an error is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a space from Confluence Cloud instance A
# Try to import this space into Confluence Cloud instance B

h3. Expected Results
Space to be imported successfully.

h3. Actual Results
An error is seen in the UI:
{code:java}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unexpected local file header signature: 0x37CF6
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.v2.space.ImportSpaceServiceImpl.handleZipperProgressUpdateEvent(ImportSpaceServiceImpl.java:116)
java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:566)
{code}

h3. Workaround
In any given machine, unzip the space export backup file and re-zip it.
No changes done to the actual data - just re-zip the contents. And retry the import.
fields.summary: Cloud space exporter generates a corrupted zip file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you migrate from Server -> Cloud you need to run the Jira Macro Repair to fix the application links in pages in Confluence that uses Jira Macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a very large instance of Confluence into Cloud
 # Try to run the Jira Macro repair.

h3. Expected Results

All links get fixed.

h3. Actual Results

You will see an error message on the screen like the following:

 !image-18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

This issue seems to self-recovery after a few hours, if that doesn't occur, please, contact Atlassian Cloud support.
fields.summary: Jira Macro Repair presents an error when running in large instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a customer decides to migrate Confluence without users & groups, but the group names in the cloud are in upper case, it will break the relation between them, space permissions will not work properly.

*Note:* Confluence Server only allows group names in lower case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group in Confluence Server all in lower case.
# Create the same group in the Cloud in upper case.
# Insert this group into a space permission grid.
# Migrate to the Cloud without users and groups.

h3. Expected Results

The group membership will be case insensitive.

h3. Actual Results

Group membership will be broken.

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-15 at 11.18.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Create the group in the Cloud with the exact same casing as in the Server.
fields.summary: Group names are case sensitive in the Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Jira Issue Macro is used to get more than 100 results, the last page requested will be repeated at the end of the list of issues displayed in the macro.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an Application link between Confluence Cloud and Jira Server/DC
 # Ensure that you have a JQL query that returns more than 100 results from Jira Server/DC
 # In Confluence, create a Jira issue macro using the large query JQL and set the display options to show 500 max results. NOTE: In my testing, I also only show the issue key column
 # save the macro and publish the page
 # View the results of the macro

h3. Expected Results
The macro returns the list same as a JQL search on the Jira server

h3. Actual Results

The First 100 results will show normally.
The last page of 100 or fewer results will show up twice at the end of the list.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time.
You Can avoid the issue ascetically by limiting the result to 100 or fewer.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro repeats last requested page of issue results from Jira Server or Datacenter

fields.description:
(on) Customer would like to upload more than one Emoji at once. He would like to upload photos from several employees but we understand by doing that *Manually* (_One by One_) is not a feasible task. 

Today, according to our documentation there is no way to do that neither from User Interface or API.

Suggestion Details: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PCS-62501]

[Emojis and Special Characters |https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-symbols-emojis-and-special-characters/]
fields.summary: Customer would like to upload more than one Emoji at once

fields.description:
Jira supports named user roles for projects, which helps simplify the process of assigning permissions to different users. With so many different permissions on Confluence spaces, it gets annoying having to copy the relevant permissions to each user or group based on how that user should use the space. Then, when the names are all sorted alphabetically, it's hard to tell who plays what role within the space: who are the "admins", who are the "editors", who are the "viewers", etc.

I would like to ask that a new named role feature be added to Confluence so that I can manually create roles for a given space, such as "Viewer" or "Editor", assign permissions to that role, then assign roles to users. It would also follow that the same roles for a space be available for restricted pages withing the space, effectively acting like a custom group available only within that space. This feature could exist alongside the existing permissions structure, in case people prefer the current approach.

A workaround is to create a global group within Confluence (or the upstream directory server(s)), e.g. "Custom Space XYZ Editors" and assign permissions to that group, but that requires admin input and pollutes the global group namespace. Instead, named roles within a space's permissions would not have either of these problems.
fields.summary: Add named user roles to space and page permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inline comments are not visible intermittently 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create inline comments on any page
# Refresh the page and the inline comments are not visible 
# the issues is intermittent 

h3. Expected Results
inline comments should be visible and highlighted all the time 
h3. Actual Results

Intermittently Inline comments are not visible, inline highlights are missing 

h3. Workaround

Create a new inline comment on the page and the rest of the inline comments are visible again.
fields.summary: Inline comments are not visible intermittently
Copying a page with body causes the image not be shown on the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Cloud has a [default homepage|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/configure-the-site-homepage/] also known as the dashboard where you can explore your recent spaces and pages and stay updated on what’s happening on your site. 

!image-20200509-194930@2x.png|width=495,height=263!
h3. Suggestion

It would be nice to allow our customers the ability to customize the Home dashboard. This way, customers would be able to remove a space that they won't find useful although they have visited it recently, for example. Therefore, this is a suggestion to allow the Confluence Cloud Home dashboard to be more customizable.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the Confluence Cloud dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you copy a page the emoji that was added to the title through the *Add emoji* button and header image added through the *Add header image* button do not copy with the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your Confluence instance
 # *Create* a new page
 # *Add emoji* to the page title
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-20 at 11.53.26.png!
 # *Add header image* to the page
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-20 at 11.53.31.png!
 # *Publish* the page
 # Select the *More actions* ( *•••* ) menu
 # Select *Copy*
 # Choose which space you want it to end up in and which parent page you want to create it under
 # Select *Copy*

h3. Expected Results
 * The copied page should be the exact same as the original one and include the emoji and the header image as well.

h3. Actual Results
 * The copied page does not include the emoji and the header image.

Original page:

!Screen Shot 2021-10-20 at 11.49.04.png|width=320,height=196!

Copied page:

!Screen Shot 2021-10-20 at 11.49.41.png|width=336,height=125!
h3. Workaround

There is a workaround that may be applied to this bug at this moment regarding emoji:
 * It is possible to add an emoji through keyboard shortcuts (usually *Ctrl+.* on Windows or *⌘+Ctrl+Spacebar* on Mac) to the title and it will be copied as well. 

Currently, there is no known workaround for the header image behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: When you copy a page the emoji and header image do not copy with the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Task due dates sometimes show a day off from the assigned date in the task report macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create tasks on a page assign date  for example 21 October 
 # Step 2 Create task report macro on another page to see task report.

h3. Expected Results
The due date should be the same (21 October)

h3. Actual Results
The due date shows 20 October.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Task due dates sometimes show a day off from the assigned date in task report macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - Scrolling down in a Page Tree sorted as Default do not show *View More* button when it is known there are several more pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - In a Space with several pages (In the ticket, Space has 1830 active pages), when Page Tree is sorted by Default View, it only shows a limited number of Pages (*Max. 25 pages on left navigation bar*).

 - If the same Page Tree is sorted differently, for example using "*View - Title - A to Z*", a certain number of pages shows up and then "*View More*" button at the bottom of the list.

 - If we click on _View More_ button, additional pages are loaded in the Page Tree (Left Navigation Bar).

h3. Expected Results
 - When open Page Tree using a Default View, in case there are several pages, it is expected to show "_View More_" button.

h3. Actual Results
 - Page Tree Default View is expected to show *View More* button when there are several pages in a Space.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scrolling down in a Page Tree sorted as Default do not show View More button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new page in Confluence, we have the option to import an external .docx file. This feature doesn't work neither when adding a file nor when integrating it with Google Docs.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence.
# On the site bar, click on *Import*.
# Choose a Word/Google doc file.

h3. Expected Results

The Word file should be converted into a Confluence page.
h3. Actual Results

The import fails with the following error message:


{code}
This file can't be imported
We ran into issues because the file may the wrong type, password protected, or read-only.
{code}

h3. Workaround

Users can either import Word files by visiting an existing page and clicking on *More actions (...) > Advanced details > Import word document*

OR

simply copy and paste the content from the Word doc.
fields.summary: Unable to import a Word file when creating a new page in Confluence

fields.description:
For privacy/confidentiality concerns, it's not enough to be able to delete space watchers, we need to disable watching. We have a large enterprise and can't disable watching across the enterprise so we need to be able to completely disable watching on a space basis. Preferably configurable under Permissions or a simple check-box on Manage Watchers.

Stylesheet allows the removal of the Watch button for a space, but does not disable the shortcut (like removing buttons from the header does.) If there is something else we can remove using Stylesheet that would also be acceptable.
fields.summary: Disable Space Watching

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While it is possible to [add comments on file|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/share-and-comment-on-files/#Shareandcommentonfiles-Commentonafile], it is no longer possible to see the pin button that used to appear on the Page's attachments menu, to add comments on a file, as specified on the documentation.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page (legacy editor or new editor)
 # Edit the page and add an attachment there (.pdf or .doc .docx for example)
 # Publish the page
# Go to the page menu (...) > Attachments
# Click on the View button for the attachment

fields.description:
As of the time of this writing, the New Confluence editor (fabric) does not provide any warnings or Tooltips to users that are trying to publish a page without filling in the title of the page.

Since the area for the page title is often occupied by tip text that does not actually provide a name for the page, It is easy to overlook that the title needs to be populated at a glance.

As such, I would like to recommend that a tooltip on hover or on click of the greyed-out publish button provide an explanation to the user as to why they are unable to publish the page.
fields.summary: Add Tooltip or notification when user tries to publish a page with no title

fields.description:
As of the time of this writing, Creating a new Retrospectives page does not automatically populate the title.

Creating a new meeting notes page does automatically populate the title which allows for instant publishing of the page.

This creates an incongruity of the experiences for these pages, which results in a worse experience for the end user.

To resolve this, I would like to propose that the creation of pages from blueprints contain a pre-populated title.
fields.summary: Creating a new Retrospectives page does not automatically populate the title

Would like an API endpoint to ‘export to PDF’ for a version of a page. Want to be able to ‘render for printing’

*Use case - Auditing*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - Clicking on an email like "*@<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net" link created in a Confluence Page, automatically redirects user to "https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/home" site. Usually Atlassian Products, Projects from Jira in this case can have its inbox monitored by users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a Confluence page, copy and paste the following links in the page body.
 - Replace <_INSTANCE_> by the instance name you are using to test.
 - You can type email address using *Mailto* HTML/HREF attribute or not, it does not make difference after you Publish the page.

[username@|mailto:username@]<_INSTANCE_>.atlassian.net (Directs to wiki page - "https://<_INSTANCE_>.atlassian.net/wiki/home")
 [username@|mailto:username@]<_INSTANCE_>.atlassian.com (Calls Default Email Client)
 [username@atlassian.net|mailto:username@atlassian.net] (Calls Default Email Client)
 [username@atlassian.com|mailto:username@atlassian.com] (Calls Default Email Client)
 [username@|mailto:username@]<_ANY_DOMAIN_>.* (Calls Default Email Client)
 - Note that clicking on an email like "_*@<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net_", link automatically redirects user to "_https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/home_".
 - Repeat the test by clicking on other email links and you will noticed all of them besides the first one opens a default email client.

h3. Expected Results
 - It is expected when hitting the link created in a Confluence Page to an email address using @<_INSTANCE_>.atlassian.net, it automatically opens default email client application.

h3. Actual Results
 - When hitting an email link using username@<_INSTANCE_>.atlassian.net it currently directs you to main Wiki Page

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User clicking in an email created in a Confluence Page automatically directs you to main Wiki Page

fields.description:
Numbered lists in confluence should be more flexible. Please make the numbered list feature be able to do the following: 
 # Begin a numbered list on a user defined number greater than 1
 # Add ability for Numbered list to count incrementally over upper and lowercase alphabet or roman numeral characters  
 # Numbering for numbered list should be available to 4 digits
 # 0 should be a valid starting point for numbered list. 

+*Explanation and user cases:*+

*1.  Begin Numbered List on a  user defined number greater than 1:* 
Our department regularly has reasons to count through a document rather than an ordered list. If the feature to start on a number higher than one is available it will allow us to maintain order numbering throughout the document while also allowing us to count consecutively where there are no breaks in items. In this scenario the shift-enter workaround does not meet our requirements. 

  This feature is also requested as we have documents being entered into the confluence space that have a preexisting consecutive numbering system beginning above one. Allowing the numbered lists to start on a user defined number would allow us to use automated counting that matches an existing documents counting.  



*2.* *Add ability for Numbered list to count incrementally over alphabet or roman numeral characters* :

The numbered list feature should also include the ability to count through upper and lowercase alphabet characters and roman numerals. This feature should count based on the user's input.

Examples: 
 # Counting starting with A should be A,B,C
 # Counting starting with a should be a,b,c
 # Counting starting with I should be I, II, III
 # Counting starting with i should be i, ii, iii, iv

*3. Numbering for numbered list should be available to 4 digits*

Numbering should be available to four digits 0-9999

 

*4. 0 should be a valid starting point for numbered list.* 

 

0 should be a valid starting integer for starting a numbered list. This feature could be helpful to both developers referencing the first index in a list, and any industry that uses 0 to indicate the first value in a series.
fields.summary: Improve flexibility of numbered lists

h3. Issue Summary
If a user has a ":" character in their Atlassian Account ID (e.g. xxxxxx:xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx) they won't be able to create a calDav synchronization.

{code:none}https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/myself{code}


h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Follow the steps listed [here|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook/] to try to synchronize the calendar using calDav 

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to create the integration

h3. Actual Results

| !Screen Shot 2021-10-13 at 6.24.19 PM.png|thumbnail! |

The following errors are registered in the backend logs:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a page
 * takes long enough to load (greater than the time out period)
 * and, doesn't change during that delay
 * and, hasn't loaded the anchor macros yet

The deep link scrolling mechanism times out and can't find an anchor macro to scroll to.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that takes a long time to load before macros are loaded (possibly with an external image reference or large amounts of smart links)
 # Add an anchor macro (or header) to the page
 # Try to navigate to the deep link target (anchor macro or header) by adding `#<target id>` to the page URL.

h3. Expected Results

- Page takes time to load and when it settles (stops changing) for more than a few seconds, the page scrolls to the desired target.
h3. Actual Results

When the page eventually loads, there is no scrolling.
(note: that the the final position may not be directly at the top if there are macros that expanded and caused the content to shift, this isn't a scroll issue, it's just due to normal macro expansion)
h3. Workaround

The only known workaround would be to reduce the amount of time the page takes to load.
fields.summary: Deep link scrolling times out before macro anchors load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars allows you to [subscribe to an external Calendar using an iCal URL|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-add-and-edit-calendars/]. However, if the Calendar is provided on a *compressed response*, the subscription won't be created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence Cloud (make sure you have a Premium subscription).
 # Navigate to *Apps > Calendar* on the top navigation bar.
 # Click on the *+* on the sidebar > *Subscribe by URL*.
 # Enter the *iCal URL*, *Calendar Name* and specify a *Space* for it.
 # Click on *Subscribe*.

h3. Expected Results

A subscription from the external Calendar is created on Team Calendars.
h3. Actual Results

The subscription fails with below error message:

_*"Specified calendar does not exist. Possible problems: Check that the Calendar URL you provided exists and you have the correct permissions to access it."*_
h3. Workaround

You can access the link directly on the browser - this should download the ICS file from this Calendar. Then, you can import this ICS file directly on Team Calendars. This method wouldn't create a subscription, which means that changes applied to the external Calendar wouldn't sync to Team Calendars.
fields.summary: Unable to subscribe to a Calendar via URL if the response is compressed

# Choose "Product Requirements" or "Retrospective"
# Add a Title and Publish the pager 

h3. Expected Results
The page is published 

h3. Actual Results

{quote}Something's gone wrong. Try again later. {quote}

!image-2021-10-08-19-06-49-287.png|thumbnail! 

Browser Console shows:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to add a hyperlink to a Confluence "native" emoji placed on the page. The link is not applied to the emoji.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page 
 # Add a Confluence native emoji (from the Emoji macro)
 # Try to add a link to this Confluence native emoji

h3. Expected Results

The link should be applied to the Confluence native emoji as well.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, when we add a link to a text on a Confluence page, this link isn’t applied to a Confluence native emoji. Instead of it, it applies to the whole text, including the spacing of words. It seems that it does not recognize the Confluence native emoji as a part of the link’s display name:
!Screen Shot 2021-10-08 at 15.38.30.png|width=314,height=91!
h3. Workaround

There are actually two workarounds that may be applied to this bug at this moment:
 # Insert an emoji through keyboard shortcuts (usually *Ctrl+.* on Windows or *⌘+Ctrl+Spacebar* on Mac)
!Screen Shot 2021-10-08 at 15.40.15.png|width=311,height=95!
 # Insert an emoji image instead of the emoji through the *Files & images* macro
!Screen Shot 2021-10-08 at 15.42.02.png|width=303,height=139!
fields.summary: Unable to add links to emojis

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars cannot parse some calendars properly from ical link when trying to subscribe by url.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From Team calendar, add a calendar using "Subscribe by URL" option.
 # Add an ical link, select a space

h3. Expected Results

Calendar should be added to team calendar with entries.
h3. Actual Results

An error is encountered
!image-2021-10-08-22-43-15-007.png|width=100,height=113!
{code:java}
Specified calendar does not exist. Possible problems: Check that the Calendar URL you provided exists and you have the correct permissions to access it.
{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Calendars cannot parse some calendars properly from ical link when trying to subscribe by url.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Export to word fails when Jira issue description field contains @user-mention
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project A with more than 1 issues
 # Mention any user in any of the issue's description field
 # Create a confluence page and add Jira issue macro to display the results of project A
 # Make sure to select the *description* field in the Jira macro
 # Export the page to word

h3. Expected Results

The page should be exported to word without issues.
h3. Actual Results

Error message appears: We will be back in a flash 
h3. Workaround

Either remove the user from the issue description field in jira OR

avoid selecting the description field in Jira macro on confluence page
fields.summary: Export to word fails when jira issue description field contains @user-mention

fields.description: Enable email notifications for a space creation to the site users
fields.summary: Email notification for space creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user accesses a non-existent page URL for a space (I.E. the URL of a page that is already deleted), the message that "*We can’t find the page*" will be displayed, which also shows all pages of the space, including the hidden ones above the homepage.

h3. Suggestion

Since this could be exposing pages that are not supposed to be viewed, this is a suggestion to not display the hidden pages when a non-existent URL is accessed.

As a workaround, the user can restrict a parent page of the hidden pages so it will restrict them to be visible, even accessing these URLs.
fields.summary: Avoid displaying hidden pages when accessing a non-existent URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an external collaboration user is also a JSM user, Confluence will treat the user as a JSM user. Therefore, the user can't access any External Collaboration spaces.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSM user
 # Add to a guest group in Confluence with external collaboration
 # Update the permissions on the space to include guests

Reference: [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/invite-guests-for-external-collaboration/]
h3. Expected Results

Guests should have access to the space
h3. Actual Results

If the user is also a JSM user, they won't have access.

h3. Workaround
No current workaround without removing JSM access.
fields.summary: Guest users cannot access external collaboration spaces if they are also a JSM user

fields.description:
When using the Inline Tasks API ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-inline-tasks/#api-group-inline-tasks)] specifying a Confluence page with the pageId parameter, the response returns the inline tasks of this page and also the ones available in child pages. 
Therefore, the feature request is to search the inline tasks only of the specific page mentioned in the pageId.
fields.summary: List inline tasks only for the specific Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Restricting a label on Label List Macro doesn't prevent to add it to other spaces
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a label in a page
 # Use label list macro to restrict it to the space
 # Try to add the label in a page from another space

h3. Expected Results

The label shouldn't appear in other spaces when restricted.
h3. Actual Results

The label list macro is ignoring the restrictions and the label is being showed in other spaces.

!Screen Shot 2021-10-07 at 11.01.19 AM.png|width=557,height=212!

!Screen Shot 2021-10-07 at 11.02.43 AM.png|width=555,height=223!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restricting a label on Label List Macro doesn't prevent to add it to other spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The numbers of task being displayed on exported PDF or Words pages will only display the first page  ( 40 tasks) of "Task Report" when the number of tasks per page are being limited.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Add "Task Report" that contains more than 40 tasks and save
 # Export to PDF or Words

h3. Expected Results
 * The content on the PDF or Words display all the Tasks from the report

h3. Actual Results
 * Only the first Task Report page is being displayed

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Export to PDF or Words don't display all tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Page Property macro contains a table with a merged row, then the table values of the aren't rendered in the Page Properties Report macro. This issue is replicated in both legacy and the new editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page with a page property macro
* Add a table with a few rows and add a merged row anywhere in the table.
* Now try to display the table values in the Page Properties Report macro.
* The fields are rendered empty like in the screenshot below.

 !Screenshot 2021-10-07 at 6.24.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The required rows should be displayed or there should be an error thrown.

h3. Actual Results
Empty values are rendered in the Page Properties Report macro

h3. Workaround

Remove the merged row and the expected values are rendered.
fields.summary: Page property Report macro doesn't render values if there is a merged row in Page Property table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Confluence space is open to any logged-in user (unlicensed), customer from service desk will be able to access its pages without a Confluence license, which is something expected.

Although, when accessing a page through its direct link and thus being asked to login, customers from Jira Service Manager will face a "<e-mail> doesn't have access to Confluence on <instancename>.atlassian.net" message.

Simply trying to access the page again will work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link the Confluence space to the Jira Service Management project and set it to *Logged-in users* in the settings.  !Screen Shot 2021-12-09 at 11.52.41 AM.png|width=416,height=281!
 # Add a customer user with a valid Atlassian Account
 # Add the same account as a user in the site, but without access to any product
 # Have that user access any page from the space

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to access the page without problems
h3. Actual Results

The user will receive a "<e-mail> doesn't have access to Confluence on <instancename>.atlassian.net" message.
Please check the video below for more details:
 - [^conf_jsm_customer.mp4]

h3. Workaround

Simply trying to access the page again after logging in will work.
fields.summary: JSM Customers be blocked from accessing a Confluence page after logging in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a video is [attached to a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/upload-a-file/], if a user tries to access its link and opens it, instead of playing it with its additional options, the file will be stuck in a preview screen:

!video_demo.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Confluence page using Google Chrome.
# Under the option to add attachments, upload a video. For example, an mp4 file, which was used for this test.
# Publish the page.
# Right-click on the video and select either *Open video in a new tab* or *Copy video address*. Alternatively, the [Attachments macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-attachments-macro/] can be also added to the page in order to have the link to the video available without using browser functions such as to open it in a new tab or copy the address manually.
## The URL will be something like this:
{code}https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/717248724993/file_example_MP4_480_1_5MG.mp4{code} 
## Which will then, be converted to something like this:
{code}https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/dsusdd-9as9as9-4f06-8971-d8a4b6479c5f/artifact/video_640.mp4/binary?client=7d291637-da1f-4898-856b-892bbb7fb088&collection=contentId-717248724993&max-age=2592000&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiI3ZDI5MTYzNy1kYTFmLTQ4OTgtODU2Yi04OTJiYmI3ZmIwODgiLCJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpjb2xsZWN0aW9uOmNvbnRlbnRJZC03MTcyNDg3MjQ5OTMiOlsicmVhZCJdfSwiZXhwIjoxNjMzNTY0OTU1LCJuYmYiOjE2MzM1NjIwMTV9.bZ9vye0khJ0ZKN0sg-oGGY1qJ7Qxjo_PzC4saFLTgIQ {code}
# Access the URL.

*Additional notes*

* This impacts the rendering of videos displayed in the [Attachments macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-attachments-macro/] since the list of attachments is displayed as a link. For example:
 !attachments_macro.png|thumbnail! 
* The same impact happens on the *Attachments* part of the page (ellipsis button at the top-right > *Attachments* > tapping the link of the attachment)
* This impacts videos added to the page by manually copying its URL (for example, the URL for the video under the *Attachments* page) and pasting on the page.

h3. Expected Results

The video should start playing.

h3. Actual Results

The video will be stuck on a preview screen.

h3. Workarounds

* Manually access the Confluence page and tap the video in order to play it.
* Access the link with a browser like Firefox.
* For videos impacted via the Attachments macro, manually add them to the page's content.
* For links on the page, the Attachments macro, or on the Attachments session, you can also download them with *right-click* > *Save link as*)
* Tap the button at the top-right of the page > *Attachments. There, tap *Edit file*. The video will start playing and the download button will appear in the upper ribbon.
fields.summary: Accessing a video from a link will not work in Google Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 When [moving pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/] to a parent page that has restrictions implemented, although the restrictions are automatically inheritted and the padlock becomes red, upon tapping at the restrictions dialog, it will state that no restrictions are added.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Restrict a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions/] in the space.
 # Move a different page that is not part of this hierarchy to become a child page of it.

(i) The move operation can be done either via drag and drop in the sidebar or the *Reorder* pages option. Using the *Move* dialog via the page's ellipsis button does not trigger the behavior as it automatically refreshes the page.
h3. Expected Results

When tapping the restrictions dialog, a message stating that the page is inheriting restrictions should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Although the padlock becomes red and the page is actually restricted, the restriction dialog is still displaying that anyone has access to the page.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page and tap the restriction dialog again.
fields.summary: Moving a page to a restricted parent does not update the restriction dialog automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When synching a Team Calendars with Outlook using Caldav (calDav Synchronizer), event reminders won't work as expected:
* When creating the appointment through Outlook and setting a reminder, the reminder will be set to *None* when synchronizing the calendar
* When creating an appointment through Team Calendars, the event will be synched to Outlook but it won't have a reminder, despite the reminder settings on TC

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*When creating the event through Outlook*
# Create a new appointment and set a reminder to any value (e.g. 5 minutes)
# Access the *CalDav Synchronizer* tab and click *Synchronize now*
# Go to Team Calendars and confirm the event is there with the default reminder time for the specific event type (and that's expected)
# Go back to the *CalDav Synchronizer* tab on Outlook and click *Synchronize now* again
# The reminder time will be set to *None*

*When creating the event through Team Calendars*
# Create a new event on Team Calendar (make sure the event type has a reminder time set and notifications enabled)
# Access the *CalDav Synchronizer* tab on Outlook and click *Synchronize now*
# The appointment won't have a reminder time set (None)

h3. Expected Results
The reminder time should be synched between calendar and not removed (set to None) on Outlook

h3. Actual Results
The reminder time set on Outlook will be set to *None* after synching.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior, since synching the calendar again will revert any changes made to the reminder time on Outlook. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Calendar event reminders are either not synched or removed from Outlook

fields.description: UI \ UX Suggestion. On calander with multiple events when you tick the event the colour coding becomes hard to determine as the check \ tick is placed inside the colour \ key.
fields.summary: Confluence Calander (Cloud) - UI UX Suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Each space in Confluence has the *Pages* session at the sidebar, which allows users to quickly navigate and find all (non-restricted) pages of the space.

However, the hidden pages are also displayed in this session, meaning that Confluence users and anonymous can find them by using this option.
h3. Suggestion

This is a suggestion to allow the administrators of the space to optionally remove the [hidden pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/#Move-copy-andhidepages-Hidepages] from this session, avoiding exposure of pages.
fields.summary: Option to remove Hidden pages from the Pages session

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Due to the fact that changing the Overview page of a space still displays the parent page in the breadcrumbs (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72929) when a user taps the parent page of the current home page, all the (non-restricted) pages of the space will be displayed at the sidebar, including the [hidden ones|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/#Move-copy-andhidepages-Hidepages].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an administrator, [change the Overview page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-your-space-homepage/#Set-another-page-as-your-overview] to become a child page of the current Overview page.
 # Access the new Home/Overview page.
 # On the breadcrumbs at the top, tap the parent/Overview page.
 # Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results

Only the pages below the parent page should be displayed or only the child pages of the new home page.
h3. Actual Results

All pages are displayed in the sidebar, including the current home page with its other child pages and the hidden pages. If the space is open for public access, it will allow these pages to be visible to anyone around the world.
h3. Workaround

[Restrict the pages that are not supposed to be viewed|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions/].
fields.summary: Hidden pages are exposed via breadcrumb navigation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When following the steps listed in our [Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook/] article to integrate using calDav, the calendar will be initially identified as read-only by the calDav Synchronizer.

Even though it says the calendar doesn't allow deletion of calendars, we can delete events after the integration is complete.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Simply follow the steps listed in our [Subscribe to Team Calendars from Microsoft Outlook|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-microsoft-outlook/] documentation, under *Subscribing with two-way sync (CalDAV)*

h3. Expected Results
The calendar should be recognized as writeable

h3. Actual Results
The calendar is initially recognized as read-only, displaying a message saying:
{quote}Connection test successfull BUT:
\- The specified calendar doesn't allow deletion of appointments!{quote}
| !image-2021-10-06-18-34-48-112.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Even though that message is shown, we can delete appointments without any problems.
fields.summary: Synching a calendar with calDav Synchronizer on Outlook will first identify the calendar as read only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an administrator of a space [changes the overview of it|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-your-space-homepage/#Set-another-page-as-your-overview], the breadcrumbs at the top will still display the parent page of the new home page, even if the page is not displayed at the sidebar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an administrator, tap *Space settings* and select *Manage space/Details*.
 # Tap the *Edit space details* button.
 # Under the *Home page* field, change the Overview page to become a child page of the current home page.
 # *Save* the configuration.
 # Access the new Home/Overview page

h3. Expected Results

The breadcrumbs at the top should stop at the new overview page.
h3. Actual Results

The breadcrumbs will still display parent page(s) even if they are "above" the current overview page.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the Overview page of a space still displays the parent page in the breadcrumbs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

By default, when a [site backup is triggered|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-a-site-backup/], the process will start until it is finished or fails. As an administrator of Confluence, it is needed to manually check the status of the backup to confirm if it can be downloaded or any failures that need to be worked.

This process can be a bit time-consuming since it will be needed to come back to the backup generation part until it is over.
h3. Suggestion

As [the process to create or copy a sandbox|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/], this is a suggestion to notify the administrators when the backup is finished with messages like the following:
 * The backup is finished and ready to be downloaded! Access the Backup Manager in order to start downloading it for the next 14 days.
 * The backup has failed! Access the Backup manager for more details and contact the support team for the investigation.

(i) This also helps to keep a past download link if there is a need to download a previously generated backup.
fields.summary: Notify administrators about backup generation results

fields.description:
As a user I would like to have static link "https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action" redirected automatically to new Space Directory Link "https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces".

This is causing users that have booked the first link to face 404 Page not Found
fields.summary: Space Directory former link does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Attachment Maximum Size' unexpectedly changed to 100 MB (default value) from 10000 MB in the customer's environment. No manual change is recorded in Audit logs or in DB (backend).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
NA

h3. Expected Results
This value should not change unless changed manually

h3. Actual Results
The value was changed from 10000 MB to 100 MB without any event logged

h3. Workaround
Change the value back to 10000 MB manually in attachment settings in confluence.
fields.summary: 'Attachment Maximum Size' unexpectedly changed to default (100 MB) in General Settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page does not get created via the Create from Template button when the template contains a variable & there is an Advance roadmap for Jira macro on the same page where the create from template macro is added. 

Also, this is only happening in legacy editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in legacy editor and add advance roadmap for Jira macro
 # now, add a create from template macro and use a template that contains a variable
 # publish the page

h3. Expected Results

Clicking on create from template button should create a page
h3. Actual Results

Page doesn't get created when user clicks on create from template button. Nothing happens
h3. Workaround
 * Convert the page to new editor OR
 * Remove the variable from the global template
fields.summary: Page does not get created via the Create from Template button

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an image sits inside a table, which sits inside a layout, in the editor, it can be resized to be very small. However, when viewed in the renderer (publish), it loses the small size/dimension. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a layout, then add a table inside the layout. Then add an image inside a table cell.
# Resize the image down as small as possible (it will be very tiny).

h3. Expected Results
Image in Editor has same size in Renderer.

h3. Actual Results
Image is smaller in editor, compared to Renderer

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images (in table in layout) resized very small in Editor don't persist that size in Renderer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The CONFCLOUD-58034 has been deployed, allowing customers to have the UNDO/REDO buttons but some customers are still not being able to access this feature.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page on editor, it can be new pages or pages already published.

h3. Expected Results

Customers should be seeing the UNDO/REDO buttons.
h3. Actual Results

Some customers are still not seeing the function.
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some customers still do not have the UNDO/REDO button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we attach a video file to our page, the Attachments macro is not allowing us to preview the file and watch it from Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add the [Attachments macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-attachments-macro/];
# Upload a video to your page;
# Publish it;
# Either do:
a. Click over the file name;
b. Expand the file info and click over the *View* button.

h3. Expected Results
a. The file should be loaded in the browser window to allows us to either download it or view it;
b. The preview pop-up happens and we can view the video.

h3. Actual Results
a. The file loads in the browser window but as if it wasn't there.
b. The preview pop-up happens, but it doesn't preview the file.

h3. Workaround
You can download the file locally and watch it from your computer, or attach the video file directly to the page, so you can watch it from Confluence.
fields.summary: Attachments macro doesn't reproduce video files

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upon using the [Page Properties macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] in combination with the [Page properties report one|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/], if the text of the heading row/column has a blank space in the Page Properties, the information will not be displayed in the Page Properties Report.

This might be expected since the macro expects the exact column/row names in order to retrieve the information.
h3. Suggestion

Similar to the legacy editor, this is a suggestion to ignore blank spaces on the titles, making it safe to have the information displayed without necessarily needing to edit the page to double-check if that could be the root cause!
fields.summary: When using the Page Properties macro, ignore the blank spaces on table headings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Content of a custom *user picker* field is not being displayed on Jira issue/filter macro in Confluence pages.

This happens for *multiple* users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project.
 # Create a custom *user picker* field (multipleusers).
 # Add the field to an issue type.
 # Populate the field.
 # Create a Confluence page.
 # Add the "Jira issue/filter" macro to this page.
 # Create a query to search project where you added information to the custom *user picker* field created.
 # Open the *Display options* of the macro
 # Add the custom field created in the *Columns to display*

h3. Expected Results

The macro will show the columns set in the search of your macro and the proper information of those fields.
h3. Actual Results

The custom *user picker* field is not populated.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira issue/filter macro is not showing information from custom user picker field created in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a Confluence page as anonymous user, we will see an error alert.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Anonymous space
# Create a page
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
Page published and created without error messages

h3. Actual Results
Page is created but won't actually complete the publish cycle and go into the view mode (a popup error is shown)

{noformat}
Content failed to load
The issue should resolve on its own, but if it keeps happening, ask your admin to contact our support team and give them:

The URL of this page
The code associated with this error: hntg8s
{noformat}

 
h3. Console error messages
{noformat}
Error: GraphQL error: a0ce0ab6-3b1a-416d-a631-31129a79976d: com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.PermissionException: Anonymous access is not permitted
{noformat}

{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'user')
{noformat}

{noformat}
Error: GraphQL error: a0ce0ab6-3b1a-416d-a631-31129a79976d: Error code 403
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error when publishing page in Anonymous mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when a [Backup is generated|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-a-site-backup/], it will keep the file available for 14 days until a new backup is generated (I.E. with or without attachments, for Server or Cloud).
h3. Suggestion

For some administrators or different users that want to use different backups to be exported and later imported, it would be useful if the download links could be available for each type of backup that was created for the next 14 days.

This is a suggestion to keep more than one download link if the backup generated is different.
fields.summary: Multiple backup download links
